rename.to: azureblob: support rclone's custom transport to fix --dump XXX

body: @ncw I'll work on this, it may take one week to get this done (hope it's fine).

issue.title: azureblob : Received error: context deadline exceeded after 1m0s transfer

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Transfer of large files (via either sync or copy) times out and restarts transfer after every 1m0s. With the error "context deadline exceeded"


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.43-150-g249a523d-beta
- os/arch: darwin/amd64
- go version: go1.11.1

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Mac OS X 10.11.6

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Azure Blob Storage

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone copy -v --stats=5s source dest

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
~/gene-idx/data >> rclone copy -vv --stats=5s delphistor:gene-idx/sales sales
2018/10/12 14:06:54 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.43-150-g249a523d-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "--stats=5s" "delphistor:gene-idx/sales" "sales"]
```

issue.title: azureblob: Avoid context deadline exceeded error by setting a large TryTimeout value - Fixes #2647

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Manually setting TryTimeout value for Azure SDK to effectively an "infinite" amount of time (365 days) as rclone currently manages idle connection timeouts.  The default TryTimeout within the Azure storage blob SDK is only 1 minute and causes the Azure server side to forcefully close the HTTP connection when the time is met even though there is likely an active data transfer occurring.   See below for example of logging seen in this situation:
```
2018-11-04 12:13:00 NOTICE: cp123: Removing partially written file on error: context deadline exceeded
2018-11-04 12:13:00 DEBUG : cp123: Received error: context deadline exceeded - low level retry 1/10
2018-11-04 12:14:16 NOTICE: cp123: Removing partially written file on error: context deadline exceeded
2018-11-04 12:14:16 DEBUG : cp123: Received error: context deadline exceeded - low level retry 2/10
... etc.
```

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes issue #2647

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: @sandeepkru I'm going to do this one as I needed it to look at another issue
This is now in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) and will be released in 1.46
